lines.gurmukhi: jl sY inkws mInu rwKIAY ptMbir mY ibnu jl qlP qjq piRA pRwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jal Sai Nikaas Meenu Raakheeai Patanbari Mai , Binu Jal Taladh Tajat Pria Praan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A fish removed from water, though kept in silk cloth yet dies having been separated from her beloved water.

lines.gurmukhi: bn sY pkr pMCI ipMjrI mY rwKIAY qau ibnu bn mn Enmno aunmwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Ban Sai Pakar Panchhee Pinjaree Mai Raakheeai Tau , Binu Ban Man Aonamano Ounamaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a bird is caught from the jungle and put in a beautiful cage with very delicious food, his mind is seen to be restless without the freedom of the jungle.

lines.gurmukhi: BwmnI Bqwir ibCurq Aiq CIn dIn iblK bdn qwih Bvn BieAwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaamanee Bhataari Bichhurat Ati Chheen Deena , Bilakh Badan Taahi Bhavan Bhaiaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a pretty woman becomes weak and grieved on separation from her husband. Her face looks perplexed and confused and she feels scared of her own home.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gurisK ibCuriq swDsMgiq sY jIvn jqn ibnu sMgq n Awn hY ]514]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gursikh Bichhurati Saadhasangati Sai , Jeevan Jatan Binu Sangat N Aan Hai ?514?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly separated from the saintly congregation of the True Guru, a Sikh of the Guru wails, tosses and turns, feels miserable and perplexed. Without the company of saintly souls of the True Guru, he has no other aim in life.  (514)
